p: Many of the proposed systemic therapies such as chloroquine, zinc and ACE inhibitors have all been used topically in the eye ( Table 2). Chloroquine as 0.03% chloroquine phosphate eye drops have apparently been efficacious in the management of dry eye syndrome in humans [ 75, 76]. Significant side effects were not reported, however there is a report of chloroquine keratopathy in workers chronically exposed to chloroquine dust [ 103]. Chronic usage is unlikely in the setting here proposed.
